App¶

class backend.app.ConfigManager¶

Manage configuration as a singleton.

This class ensures only one instance exists and loads configuration such as API keys from environment variables or uses default values.

Variables:

  • _instance – The singleton instance of the class.

  • config – The configuration dictionary containing API keys and other settings.

load_config()¶

Load API keys and other config from environment or defaults.

Loads configuration values such as API keys from environment variables, or uses default values if not set.

Returns:

None

class backend.app.OpenWeatherMapStrategy(api_key)¶

Implement strategy for using OpenWeatherMap API.

Implements methods to fetch current weather and forecast using OpenWeatherMap.

Variables:

api_key – The API key for OpenWeatherMap.

get_forecast(city)¶

Fetch weather forecast from OpenWeatherMap.

Retrieves the weather forecast data for the specified city using the OpenWeatherMap API.

Parameters:

city (str) – The name of the city.

Returns:

The weather forecast data for the city.

Return type:

dict

class backend.app.WeatherServiceFacade¶

Provide a simple interface to get weather data and forecast.

This class hides the complexity of different weather API strategies and provides a unified interface for fetching weather data.

Variables:

  • config – The configuration manager instance.

  • strategy – The weather API strategy used for fetching data.

get_forecast(city)¶

Get weather forecast for a city.

Fetches the weather forecast data for the specified city using the selected strategy.

Parameters:

city (str) – The name of the city.

Returns:

The weather forecast data for the city.

Return type:

dict

class backend.app.WeatherStrategy¶

Define base class for weather API strategies.

Subclasses should implement methods to fetch weather data.

get_weather(city)¶

Get current weather for a city.

This method should be implemented by subclasses to fetch weather data.

Parameters:

city (str) – The name of the city.

Returns:

dict

backend.app.api_weather_temperature()¶

Define API endpoint to get temperature data for charting.

Returns temperature values and labels (dates) for a city, formatted for use in charts.

Returns:

JSON response containing temperature values and labels.

Return type:

Response

backend.app.get_forecast(city)¶

Define API endpoint to get weather forecast for a city.

Returns forecast data as JSON for the specified city.

Parameters:

city (str) – The name of the city.

Returns:

JSON response containing forecast data.

Return type:

Response

backend.app.get_weather(city)¶

Define API endpoint to get current weather for a city.

Returns weather data as JSON for the specified city. Handles errors and returns appropriate HTTP status codes.

Parameters:

city (str) – The name of the city.

Returns:

JSON response containing weather data or error message.

Return type:

Response

backend.app.handle_disconnect()¶

Handle WebSocket disconnection.

backend.app.handle_subscribe_weather(data)¶

Handle subscription to weather updates for a city.

Periodically sends weather updates for the specified city to the client via WebSocket.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Dictionary containing the city name.

Returns:

None

backend.app.login()¶

Define API endpoint for user login.

Checks credentials against hardcoded users and returns a token if valid. Allows guest login with a special token.

Returns:

JSON response containing token and user info, or error message.

Return type:

Response
